title: Adelino Castelo David
text:
Adelino Santiago Castelo David (born 1955) is a Santomean bank manager and politician.
Biography.
David graduated with a doctorate. He became a bank manager and was later president of Caixa Nacional de Poupanças e Crédito. In 1992, he became posted as governor of the <a href="Central%20Bank%20of%20S%C3%A3o%20Tom%C3%A9%20and%20Pr%C3%ADncipe">Central Bank of São Tomé and Príncipe</a>, the post was later taken by Carlos Quaresma Batista da Silva in 1994. Afterwards he worked at the <a href="World%20Bank">World Bank</a> and work as a consultant to his national government.
On January 5, 1999, he became Minister of Finance and Planning under the Prime Minister <a href="Guilherme%20Posser%20da%20Costa">Guilherme Posser da Costa</a> up to 26 September 2001. He was later advisor to the finance minister from 2002 to 2004.
Once more, he became Minister of Finance and Planning under Prime Minister <a href="Dami%C3%A3o%20Vaz%20d%E2%80%99Almeida">Damião Vaz d’Almeida</a> from 18 September 2004 to 2 June 2005. Later, he was temporary a consultant to the finance minister.
